channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @eddyportnoy @TheJewishDream @elivalley Will chip in.
item.source:markdown: @eddyportnoy @TheJewishDream @elivalley Will chip in.

item.description: @DandiaAsad I think he's more a vibes kind of a guy.
item.source:markdown: @DandiaAsad I think he's more a vibes kind of a guy.

item.description: @AsafShaloo @drvolts By transmitting power along lines that weren’t originally optimized for that purpose. So it becomes a transmission problem.
item.source:markdown: @AsafShaloo @drvolts By transmitting power along lines that weren’t originally optimized for that purpose. So it becomes a transmission problem.

item.description: @AsafShaloo @drvolts Problem because electrification significantly increases electric demand, and solar/wind generates it at different times and places than where it is consumed.
item.source:markdown: @AsafShaloo @drvolts Problem because electrification significantly increases electric demand, and solar/wind generates it at different times and places than where it is consumed.

item.description:
@AsafShaloo Transmission is currently a Big Problem. See @drvolts who is worth a follow both as an energy expert and someone really good at writing really complicated, really long technical stories that read very, very smoothly.

@AsafShaloo @drvolts Local storage is probably more efficient and cheaper than shuffling electrons across the continent.
item.source:markdown:
@AsafShaloo Transmission is currently a Big Problem. See @drvolts who is worth a follow both as an energy expert and someone really good at writing really complicated, really long technical stories that read very, very smoothly.
@AsafShaloo @drvolts Local storage is probably more efficient and cheaper than shuffling electrons across the continent.

item.description: Gotta admire the ability of the @forverts to stay calm as the the well-funded big guy in the journalism block tests the waters on entering their market. https://t.co/ZdaMSZreF9
item.source:markdown: Gotta admire the ability of the @forverts to stay calm as the the well-funded big guy in the journalism block tests the waters on entering their market. https://t.co/ZdaMSZreF9

item.description: @lavietidhar Isaac Asimov would be on volume 6 of Kanga and Empire by now!
item.source:markdown: @lavietidhar Isaac Asimov would be on volume 6 of Kanga and Empire by now!

item.description: @DandiaAsad I remember when the Koch Administration sponsored large screen PSA’s to reduce population pressure. Nonetheless, I migrated to Manhattan from Upstate six weeks after this one was released. https://t.co/l5DnnTxr4N

item.description: Do you think the excellent secular education Jared Kushner received at his yeshiva high school helped him explain why his father refused to surrender top secret documents, or would he have been better off spending more time studying Talmud in Yiddish? #JewishEducation #Chinuch https://t.co/xPqhGkgMg5
item.source:markdown: Do you think the excellent secular education Jared Kushner received at his yeshiva high school helped him explain why his father refused to surrender top secret documents, or would he have been better off spending more time studying Talmud in Yiddish? #JewishEducation #Chinuch https://t.co/xPqhGkgMg5

item.description: @akivaw It may not be true. Not sure about the circles. But pretty sure we have neurons that recognize horizontal lines and others that parse vertical.
item.source:markdown: @akivaw It may not be true. Not sure about the circles. But pretty sure we have neurons that recognize horizontal lines and others that parse vertical.

item.description: @akivaw Don’t we have visual processors for angles and for circles? In which case X and O light up totally different neurons.
item.source:markdown: @akivaw Don’t we have visual processors for angles and for circles? In which case X and O light up totally different neurons.

item.description: @rev_avocado @BKBPReynoso If he really wanted to honor the memory of the Holocaust, he would have the city cut its ties with the responsible party — namely Zionists. (At least according to some of the Hasidic communities under discussion.)
item.source:markdown: @rev_avocado @BKBPReynoso If he really wanted to honor the memory of the Holocaust, he would have the city cut its ties with the responsible party — namely Zionists. (At least according to some of the Hasidic communities under discussion.)

item.description: @kampeas Say what you want about Philip Roth, but at least he appreciated the dangers of polio.

item.description: @Dem_Bitz @RabbiHarvey Have you ever tried to engage a shaliach in the study of non-Chabad Torah? Were you more successful than I was?

item.description:
@BlueNWildRose @QueenMab87 Freedom toast? Freedom kissing?

@BlueNWildRose @QueenMab87 But then, I’m still not convinced the Cheney gang wasn’t responsible for the anthrax attacks.

item.description: @TheRaDR Gotta say, “God is dead” is a much better hypothesis than “God is alive but makes no objections when various goofballs claim to be his best friend.”
item.source:markdown: @TheRaDR Gotta say, “God is dead” is a much better hypothesis than “God is alive but makes no objections when various goofballs claim to be his best friend.”

item.description: @KalmanYeger @YWN Hey, is it true that 9/11 was just like attending one of your city’s public schools? https://t.co/LQjiBtW2g1

item.description: @jh_swanson The worst attack, but not as deadly as attending a NYC public school, if the recent ad in a haredi publication is to be believed. https://t.co/CJUMP9JSuC
